Detailed Description

This class handles the actual management of the thread pool for TaskManagerTP.

See also:
TaskManagerTP

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

BasicThreadPool::BasicThreadPool ( void   )  [inline]

This is the basic constructor for BasicThreadPool.

Member Function Documentation

void BasicThreadPool::Initialize ( u32  inNumThreads = 0  ) 

Call this to create the threads for the thread pool.

Parameters:
inNumThreads the number of threads to create, or 0 to request an optimum number of threads, based upon the number of logical processors

void BasicThreadPool::Shutdown ( void   ) 

Call this to ensure that all of the threads in the thread pool exit properly.

u32 BasicThreadPool::GetThreadCount ( void   )  [inline]

This method returns the number of threads in the thread pool. Not all of these threads may be enabled to run WorkItems.

Returns:
the number of threads in the thread pool
See also:
BasicThreadPool::Initialize, BasicThreadPool::GetActiveThreadCount

u32 BasicThreadPool::GetActiveThreadCount ( void   )  [inline]

This method returns the number of threads in the thread pool which are actually enabled.

Returns:
the number of threads in the thread pool which are actually enabled

void BasicThreadPool::SetActiveThreadCount ( u32  uCount  ) 

Call this method to constrain the number of threads which are enabled to run WorkItems.

Parameters:
uCount the number of threads in the thread pool to enable

void BasicThreadPool::QueueUserWorkItem ( WorkItem *  pItem  ) 

Call this method to put a WorkItem on the queue for execution.

Parameters:
pItem the WorkItem to enqueue

WorkItem * BasicThreadPool::RemoveWorkItem ( void   ) 

This method pulls and returns a WorkItem from the execution queue.

Returns:
a WorkItem on the execution queue

void BasicThreadPool::NonStandardThreadExecute ( ThreadContext::ThreadCallback  pfnCallback,
void *  pData 
)

Call this method from the primary thread to wait until each thread in the thread pool, including the disabled threads, call the specificied callback method.

Parameters:
pfnCallback the callback that each thread should call
pData the data that is passed to the pfnCallback
See also:
TaskManagerTP::NonStandardPerThreadCallback
